div.p:
佛言 佛告 復次 ： 「舍利弗，汝問云何名
佛，云何觀佛者。不生、不滅，
不來、不去，非名 、非相，是名
為佛。如自觀身實相，觀佛
亦然。唯有智者，乃能知耳。
是名觀佛 。」
Introduction to the Fifty-Four Character Passage from the Scripture on the Perfection of Wisdom Spoken By Mañjuśrī on the Nature of the Buddha and How To Contemplate Him.

The text is drawn from Mandrasena's (Mantuoluoxian 曼陀羅仙) translation of the Śaptaśatikā prajñāpāramitā (the Perfection of Wisdom in 700 Lines), titled The Great Perfection of Wisdom as Taught by Mañjuśrī (Wenshushili suoshuo moheboreboluomi 文殊師利所說摩訶般若波羅蜜; T #232). Mandrasena arrived in China in 503 and was active in the Liang Dynasty (502-557) in the south. He is said to have come from Funan 夫南, a country identified with part of the region now occupied by modern Cambodia. This scripture was also translated by Saṃgabhara (Sengqiepolo 僧伽婆羅), who is also said to have hailed from Funan and to have sometimes worked with Mandrasena. That text, now T #233, was quoted elsewhere on Hongdingshan (no. 16.1). The passage translated here is located at T #232, 8:728a26-29. It also occurs within a section of Mandrasena’s text collected in the early eighth century translation of the Great Gem Collection Scripture (Da baoji jing 大寶積經, the Mahāratnakūṭa-sūtra; T #310, 11:652b; on which see Kaiyuan shijiao lu 開元釋教錄, T #2154, 55:586b). The context of the passage is a conversation between Śāriputra and Mañjuśrī about the nature of the Buddha. The lines that precede our passage are as follows: “Śāriputra inquired of Mañjuśrī, ‘What is named the Buddha? What is contemplating the Buddha?’ Mañjuśrī said, ‘What is it that constitutes “I”?’ Śāriputra said, ‘“I” is just a name and names are characterized by emptiness.’ Mañjuśrī said, ‘Just so! Just so! Just as “I” is a name, so as well “Buddha” is simply a name. Names are characterized by emptiness, which is none other than bodhi. Do not seek bodhi by means of names. The attributes of bodhi cannot be put in words, cannot be explained. Why is this? Because words, explanations, and bodhi are all empty’.” 舍利弗語文殊師利言: “云何名佛？云何觀佛?” 文殊師利言：“云何為我?” 舍利弗言： “我者但有名字，名字相空.” 文殊師利言： “如是，如是！如我但有名字，佛亦但有名字。名字相空，即是菩提，不以名字而求菩提。菩提之相，無言無說。何以故？言說菩提，二俱空故.” (T # 232, 8:728a).

The Buddha said, “ Śāriputra, you ask what is it that is named the Buddha? You ask how one contemplates the Buddha. Not produced, not extinguished, not come, not gone, Not a name, not an attribute— This is called the Buddha. As one contemplates the real attributes of the body, just so one contemplates the Buddha. Only those with wisdom can understand this. This is named contemplating the Buddha.”
